company_context: Lead generation for services targeting decision-makers and professionals in restaurant and retail businesses in Canada, with an emphasis on bilingual communication and operational roles.
usage_instructions: Apply LinkedIn filters such as company size 'Small Business' and employment type 'Self-Employed' where available to tightly focus on target prospects.
Use geographic filters to emphasize Canadian regions, especially Quebec for French language targeting.
Leverage bilingual queries in Priority 4 to engage French-speaking business owners effectively.
Monitor lead volume to ensure each tier produces 100+ leads by adjusting filters or expanding keywords if necessary.
Utilize these queries sequentially based on priority to maximize outreach efficiency starting from highest decision-maker influence.

tiers.name: Business Owners & Top Decision-makers
tiers.description: This tier targets the highest relevance leads including business owners and top executives who have ultimate decision-making power in restaurant and retail sectors across Canada.

results.title: Gary Hayes - Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
results.content:
Gary Hayes
Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
Pointe-Claire, Quebec, Canada
500 connections, 18052 followers


About
With a rich background in Canadian retailing, I have been at the forefront of innovative concepts that have left a lasting mark on the industry. One of my notable achievements was pioneering the BAYMART discount store concept at The Bay, long before the advent of Walmart in Canada. The success of BAYMART led to an expanded role, where I steered The Bay's foray into apparel, positioning it as a fashion leader in the 70's. Transitioning from department stores to specialty retail, I took on roles of increasing responsibility at Reitman's. As Vice President of Smart Set, and later as VP of Reitman's in the 80's, I introduced the groundbreaking in-season "item" repeat concept, a strategy that anticipated the "fast fashion" approach adopted by industry giants like Forever 21, H&M, and Zara. My journey then led me to Giant Tiger, where I devised and executed a robust fashion apparel strategy, fortifying GT against the challenges posed by Walmart. The events I orchestrated, including the PJ Party, Breast Cancer, Get Fit, Garden Party, and Canada Day celebrations, commanded a dominant presence in the market. I leverage my extensive experience in department stores, specialty retail, and discount stores to navigate the dynamic landscape of digital marketing. I know what has to be done on social media. My focus lies in evaluating retail strategies and uncovering emerging opportunities, all of which are meticulously documented in my weekly reports. THE REPORT: At the heart of my work is a weekly senior management report, meticulously crafted to unveil potential opportunities and highlight potential pitfalls. Armed with unfiltered information, this report empowers decision-makers to pose the right questions and allocate resources strategically to address the most pressing challenges.


Experience
Owner
[Retail Adventure Inc.](N/A)  
Jun 1999 - Present
Montreal, Quebec, Canada



Education
University of Oregon
Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.), Marketing/Marketing Management, General
1959 - 1963
Activities and Societies: foreign students scholarship for academic excellence.

ðð¶ðº ððð¿ð¹ð¼ð»ð´ ðð½ð½ð¼ð¶ð»ðð²ð± ð¡ð²ð ð£ð¿ð²ðð¶ð±ð²ð»ð & ððð¢ ð¼ð³ ð¥ð²ðð®ð¶ð¹ ðð¼ðð»ð°ð¶ð¹ ð¼ð³ ðð®ð»ð®ð±ð® RCC's Board of Directors is pleased to announce the appointment of [Kim Furlong](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/kimfurlong?trk=public_post-text) as the new President & Chief Executive Officer, effective September 2, 2025. Kim joins RCC with a distinguished career that spans over two decades at the intersection of government, industry, and advocacymaking her uniquely equipped to lead our organization into its next phase of growth. Currently serving as CEO of the Canadian Venture Capital & Private Equity Association (CVCA), Kim has established herself as a powerful advocate for Canada's private capital sector, successfully influencing public policy and shaping the national investment landscape. [Diane J. Brisebois](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/diane-j-brisebois-87629412?trk=public_post-text) will continue to serve as President & CEO of Retail Council of Canada until Kim joins RCC in September. results.content:
Chris Meyer
Co-founder and Managing Partner FORELEFT HOSPITALITY LTD.
Canada
500 connections, 1722 followers


About
Hospitality executive and entrepreneur with over 25 years of leadership experience across Canada and the U.S., guiding restaurants, breweries, and distilleries through growth, transformation, and operational excellence. As Co-Founder and Owner of Foreleft Hospitality, I helped build and operate four distinct concepts in British Columbia—Noble at the Hills, Wayback Brew Co., Resurrection Spirits, and FRANKS Pizza & Bar—under one scalable operational and financial structure. My approach combines strategic vision with hands-on execution, enabling brand growth, team development, and exceptional guest experiences. Previously, as Vice President of Operations for CFW Group, I led a diverse portfolio spanning Joe Forte’s, The Shore Club, Ki Modern Japanese, Fleetwood’s on Front Street (Maui), and The Grill on the Alley (California). Managing over 500 employees across multiple regions, I gained extensive international operational expertise, navigating complex compliance and labor environments in competitive markets like California. My leadership style is data-driven yet people-focused: I believe that profitability and employee engagement thrive together when strategy, systems, and culture align. I excel at scaling brands, building strong teams, and delivering consistent results in dynamic hospitality landscapes.

# Chris Meyer **Co-founder and Managing Partner FORELEFT HOSPITALITY LTD.** Canada, CA 500 connections, 1722 followers ## About Hospitality executive and entrepreneur with over 25 years of leadership experience across Canada and the U

S

, guiding restaurants, breweries, and distilleries through growth, transformation, and operational excellence

As Co-Founder and Owner of Foreleft Hospitality, I helped build and operate four distinct concepts in British Columbia—Noble at the Hills, Wayback Brew Co

, Resurrection Spirits, and FRANKS Pizza & Bar—under one scalable operational and financial structure

My approach combines strategic vision with hands-on execution, enabling brand growth, team development, and exceptional guest experiences

Previously, as Vice President of Operations for CFW Group, I led a diverse portfolio spanning Joe Forte’s, The Shore Club, Ki Modern Japanese, Fleetwood’s on Front Street (Maui), and The Grill on the Alley (California)

Managing over 500 employees across multiple regions, I gained extensive international operational expertise, navigating complex compliance and labor environments in competitive markets like California

My leadership style is data-driven yet people-focused: I believe that profitability and employee engagement thrive together when strategy, systems, and culture align

I excel at scaling brands, building strong teams, and delivering consistent results in dynamic hospitality landscapes

## Experience ### Business Owner [Foreleft Hospitality LTD](N/A) Apr 2024 - Present South Surrey Founder ### Business Owner [Wayback Brewing Co.](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/wayback-brewing-co) Jun 2023 - Present Surrey, British Columbia, Canada Craft Brewery | Tap Room ### Business Owner [Resurrection Spirits](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/resurrection-spirits) Jun 2023 - Present Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada ### Executive Vice President [The CFW Group](N/A) Jun 2019 - Mar 2023 Vancouver/ Whistler/ Los Angeles/ Maui Responsible for all business operations for a boutique hospitality brand with 800 employees and $40M in revenue and well-known locations in Vancouver, Whistler, Beverly Hills ,Thousand Oaks, CA, and Maui, HI. More specifically, I lead, analyzed and executed operations strategy and process, coordinating with the executive team. I championed the company’s expectations, goals, and core values across locations as a Brand Ambassador. I nourished the soul of each restaurant and impart the vision and ambience whether a Hollywood hangout or a rich Republic. During Covid, I retrained in new methodologies and maintained a casual “come back when you are ready” flair, providing comfort and empathy to patrons. A few measurables include: • I sustained a $17M revenue stream at Joe Fortes, an award-winning boutique restaurant in Vancouver, and an increase to $19M post pandemic - $5M revenue increase in the first 3 years as Director at Fleetwood’s on Front Street a coastal restaurant in Maui, HI. In addition, I oversaw acquisitions and onboardings of multiple new boutique restaurants in Los Angeles, functioning as project lead, creating 1st year positive sales growth. I also opened a second Joe Fortes location in Whistler, BC as project lead. ### Managing Director [Fleetwood's on Front Street](N/A) Apr 2017 - Mar 2023 Lahaina, Hawaii ### General Manager [Joe Fortes Seafood & Chop House](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/joe-fortes-seafood-&-chop-house) Apr 2017 - Jun 2019 N/A During these few years before accepting a larger role, I oversaw day-to-day business operations for two CFW Group Locations: Joe Fortes, Vancouver, and Fleetwoods, Maui. I created financial reports for the regional office and liaised between facility operators and the home office. I managed all property level projects and teams. In more detail, I rebuilt and reenergized Fleetwood’s on Front, a coastal restaurant in Maui, HI, augmenting the leadership team, reorganizing the existing P&L structure, and re-strategizing the business to cater to the tourism industry. I rescued this operation from an embezzlement situation, fired leadership, and rebuilt the management team. I implemented new standards, creating an exciting culture and a hot venue for hotel concierges. I also leveraged exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, leading and mentoring an experienced team of managers at both locations, overseeing over 300 team members. I executed regular visitations and audits at each property, collaborating directly with property level teams to provide guidance and ongoing action reports. Lastly, I turned around a demoralizing, harassment ridden culture through instituting high expectations and hiring top talent. ### General Manager [ki modern japanese + bar](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/ki-modern-japanese---bar) Mar 2016 - Jun 2017 Toronto, Canada Area During this fast-paced year, I oversaw all day-to-day business operations for KI Modern Japanese, a $9M restaurant in Toronto, Ontario. I quickly but effectively sourced and seated restaurant managers and authored and executed location-specific strategic business plans. I turned over all but one in leadership, after a neglect in previous oversight and kept an amazing, passionate staff. I rebuilt and developed the restaurant team, implementing incentives for employee development. I oversaw the tricky synchronization of a hot kitchen and sushi bar with unique ingredients. I also recreated a respect for leadership from staff, learning the Japanese craft and brand and being a servant leader. I brought a lively, positive, and precise attitude to bear, creating a vibe to the guest of flawless execution. In addition, I optimized seasonal launches and menu changes while deferring to the Chef. Remarkably, I increased revenues YoY by $750K during my tenure as GM and optimized marketing impact, implementing quality operational performance and customer service standards to target new business and maintain existing clientele. ### Hy's of Canada [Hy's of Canada](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/hy's-of-canada?trk=public_profile_experience-group-header) N/A - Present Toronto, Canada Area ### Restaurant and Bar Manager [The Keg Steakhouse + Bar](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/the-keg-steakhouse-and-bar) Mar 2001 - Sep 2006 N/A ## Education ### Fleetwood Park Secondary A life long career in Restaurants, Major in Dishwashing 1994 - 1997 None ## Publications N/A ## Honors & Awards N/A ## Certifications N/A ## Volunteering N/A ## Languages N/A ## Organizations N/A ## Activity - **Thank you New Car Dealer Association for the recognition and Brian Jessel BMW dream team 😊** Liked by Chris Meyer [View Post](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/valentino-almeida-6601a760_thank-you-new-car-dealer-association-for-activity-7311449302747291648-KEzm) ![Activity Image](https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/v2/D5622AQFAOoYOJIBONw/feedshare-shrink_2048_1536/B56ZXd8ZHxHEAs-/0/1743185352516?e=2147483647&v=beta&t=rKwx2iXDM1Pjn7q7nV05PsyrWN_IgFM3_N5pVhQoHa8) - **Everywhere I go - someone waves. results.title: Retail Council of Canada
results.content:
Overview:
Retail Council of Canada (RCC) is a not-for-profit association representing small, mid, and large retail businesses in every community across the country. 𝗔𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗩𝗼𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗥𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹™ 𝗶𝗻 𝗖𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗱𝗮, 𝘄𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗱𝗹𝘆 𝗿𝗲𝗽𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝗻 𝟱𝟰,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗲𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝘁𝘀, 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗹𝘂𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗱𝗲𝗽𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁, 𝗴𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝗿𝘆, 𝘀𝗽𝗲𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹𝘁𝘆, 𝗱𝗶𝘀𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁, 𝗶𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗽𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹𝗲𝗿𝘀, 𝗼𝗻𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗾𝘂𝗶𝗰𝗸 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗮𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘁𝘀. RCC promotes and protects the retail industry through 𝗲𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗮𝗱𝘃𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗰𝘆, 𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, including: 𝗡𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲𝘀 tailored to all aspects of the retail sector. Find out more: www.retailcouncil.org/events 𝗪𝗲𝗲𝗸𝗹𝘆 𝗻𝗲𝘄𝘀𝗹𝗲𝘁𝘁𝗲𝗿 of retail industry headlines from across Canada and around the world. Subscribe today: www.retailcouncil.org/enews 𝗠𝗲𝗺𝗯𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗰𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗺𝘀 to support retailers in their various business functions. Learn more: www.retailcouncil.org/memberservices Interested in joining Retail Council of Canada’s community of retailers and industry supporters? 𝗩𝗶𝘀𝗶𝘁 𝗥𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹𝗖𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗶𝗹.𝗼𝗿𝗴 to find out how you can become a member.

# Retail Council of Canada
Empowering small, mid & large retailers in Canada through representation, communication and education #RetailMatters🍁

Part-time employment fell 5% from June and has been on a steady decline since May, likely tied to the nationwide closure of Hudson’s Bay. Youth employment remains a concern, with fewer temporary positions available between May and August than in previous years. 💡 For full insights and updated data, check out RCC's Member-only Retail Pulse Dashboard. https://hubs.ly/Q03D8zJJ0 [Likes: 4, Comments: 0]; **Retail Council of Canada** (1d Edited): 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗱𝗲 𝗨𝗽𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗲: 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗦𝗲𝗽𝘁. 𝟭, 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱, 𝗖𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗱𝗮 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘃𝗲 𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿-𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳𝘀 𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗖𝗨𝗦𝗠𝗔 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝗨.𝗦. 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘀𝘂𝗺𝗲𝗿 𝗴𝗼𝗼𝗱𝘀, while tariffs remain in place on steel, aluminum, and autos. About
Retailers must shutter traditional business methods to survive in today's marketplace.

The retail landscape is rapidly evolving: shifts from traditional brick and mortar to e-commerce, disruption, and customer needs/wants that change almost daily.

With more than 20 years of industry knowledge and experience in Merchandising, Buying, Product Development and Sourcing with luxury and mass merchant retailers in both regional and global markets - I bring the end-to-end expertise that retail brands need.

As a highly-motivated and strategic thinker, I am a Retail Industry SME and Strategist, responsible for delivering high-value engagements to clients across various sectors.  

Open to connecting with people and discuss the Retail Landscape.

Committed especially to helping the founders who didn’t go to the right schools or grow up in the right families or look like everyone else. Hustle should always matter more than pedigree. Co-founded and led Clearco (formerly Clearbanc) to become the world’s largest e-commerce investor. We’ve invested in over $3.2B in over 7,000 different companies across 10 countries. We’ve backed 25x more women than the VC industry average and backed founders in all 50 states in America by using AI to make our investment decisions and not humans. We pioneered the revenue share capital structure for ad spend and inventory that has been copied (to the enormous benefit of founders!) around the world. We were Softbank’s first Canadian investment at a near $2B valuation launching Clearco into unicorn status. Investor on CBC’s Dragons’ Den (Canada’s Shark Tank) for over 6 seasons with dozens of angel investments including Endy (acquired by Sleep Country for $89M), TruLocal (acquired by Emerge for $17M), RVezy, Thras.io, Haus, Cart.com, Sheetex, Signos, Mastermind, Inkbox, TruFan, Lillia, Lucky Iron Fish, Accompany.io, Swyft and Tokens.com. Voted Angel Investor of the Year in Canada. Committed to becoming a better leader myself. I’m constantly pushing myself out of my comfort zone and scared all the time. I’ve learned it’s never easy to lead. Loves: Cabernet, Alicia Keys, the color purple, water sports, sailing, booking airline tickets 2 hours before takeoff.


Experience
Co-Founder & Executive Chairman
[Clearco](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/getclearco)  
Apr 2016 - Present
Toronto, Canada Area
Clearco is the world’s largest e-commerce investor providing equity free capital solutions to e-commerce businesses. Clearco’s gives founders real-time access to a global network of partners in addition to insights and data tools to help support them scale their business. 

Clearco has advanced more than $3B to more than 6,500 brands, including Vanity Planet, Glamnetic, Public Goods, Soludos, and Monos. For more information visit clear.co and @getClearco.


Education
Queen's University
MBA, Dean's List
2007 - 2008
• Winner of 5 International Business Plan Competitions (Queen's, Ivey, Nebraska, Idaho, UofT) • Dare to Dream Scholarship ($15k)

## Experience ### Co-Founder & Executive Chairman [Clearco](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/getclearco) Apr 2016 - Present Toronto, Canada Area Clearco is the world’s largest e-commerce investor providing equity free capital solutions to e-commerce businesses. Clearco’s gives founders real-time access to a global network of partners in addition to insights and data tools to help support them scale their business. Clearco has advanced more than $3B to more than 6,500 brands, including Vanity Planet, Glamnetic, Public Goods, Soludos, and Monos. For more information visit clear.co and @getClearco. ### Director [Vail Resorts](https://www.linkedin.com/company/vail-resorts) Oct 2016 - Present Greater Denver Area Vail Resorts (NYSE: MTN) is the premier mountain resort company in the world and a leader in luxury, destination-based travel at iconic locations. With a market cap of over $6.8B, their mountain segment owns and operates the eleven premier resorts of Vail, Beaver Creek, Breckenridge and Keystone in Colorado, Heavenly, Northstar and Kirkwood in the Lake Tahoe area of California and Nevada, Park City Mountain Resort and Canyons in Park City, Utah, Afton Alps in Minnesota, Mt. Brighton in Michigan and Whistler Blackcomb in Canada. ### Dragon on Dragons' Den [CBC Television](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/cbc-television) Apr 2015 - Present Toronto, Canada Area ### Director [Freshii](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/freshii) Jan 2017 - Feb 2021 Toronto, Canada Area Freshii (TSX:FRII) was ranked the fastest growing multinational chain restaurant in the world for 2015 by Technomics. With over 244 locations they are at the forefront of the global health and wellness movement, pioneering the new “healthy fast food” category. Freshii reached 200 locations in 11 years - faster than McDonald's, Subway or Domino's. ### Director [Whistler Blackcomb](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/whistler-blackcomb) Jun 2015 - Oct 2016 Whistler, BC Member, Corporate Governance and & Nominating Committee Member, Compensation Committee Whistler Blackcomb (TSX: WB) is the official alpine skiing venue for the 2010 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games, is situated 125km north of Vancouver, BC. North America’s premier four season mountain resort, Whistler and Blackcomb are two side-by-side mountains which combined offer over 200 marked runs, 8,171 acres of terrain, 16 alpine bowls, three glaciers, receives on average over 1,170 centimetres (461 inches) of snow annually, and one of the longest ski seasons in North America. SKI Magazine named Whistler Blackcomb North America's #1 ski resort 3 years running. ### Head of Marketing [Groupon - Snap](https://www.linkedin.com/company/groupon) Jun 2014 - Mar 2016 Chicago Continuing my role at SnapSaves within Groupon, focusing on growth, marketing and partnership development with North American Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) companies. On first day of Snap launch in the US it was featured in both the US and CA App Stores, reached #10 in Best New Apps, #4 in Best Lifestyle Apps and #20 in Best Apps Overall. By second day, Snap was #1 in Lifestyle. ### Co-Founder [SnapSaves (Acquired by Groupon)](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/snapsaves) Mar 2012 - Mar 2016 Toronto, Canada Area SnapSaves (acquired by Groupon) is a mobile savings platform that gives you cash back for everyday purchases. As you shop, you gain dollars by simply taking a picture of your receipt and submitting it to us - our software takes care of the rest to process your cash back instantly. The disruptive mobile couponing platform enables Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) companies to market directly to consumers via smartphones, bypassing retailers and collecting valuable data. ### Co-Founder & Partner [Buytopia.ca](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/buytopia-ca) Feb 2011 - Jun 2014 Toronto, Canada • Founded and built one of Canada’s leading ecommerce companies without any external financing • Buytopia has saved its 2.5M customers $200M+ in the past 3 years by providing deals on local services, products and travel • Acquired and integrated seven competitors into the Buytopia umbrella to expand into new markets and segments • Ranked #3 of the Profit Hot 50 list of Fastest Growing Canadian Companies • Toronto Region Board of Trade Business of the Year Winner (Under 30) ### Director, Corporate Strategy & Business Improvement [Sears Canada](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/sears-canada) Dec 2009 - Feb 2011 Toronto, Canada Area ### Founder [Evandale Caviar](N/A) Jun 2008 - Dec 2009 N/A Premier producer of Wild Canadian Caviar with nationwide clientele. Vertically integrated commercial fishery based in New Brunswick. ### Founder [The Tea Room](N/A) Sep 2006 - May 2008 N/A Founded North America’s first zero consumer waste coffee shop that Maclean’s magazine called “innovative and progressive” on Queen’s campus during undergraduate studies ## Education ### Queen's University MBA, Dean's List 2007 - results.content: Congratulations to Kim Furlong on her appointment as the next President & CEO of Retail Council of Canada, effective September 2, 2025. Were excited for whats ahead under Kims leadership and the continued growth of RCC as the Voice of Retail in Canada. ðð¶ðº ððð¿ð¹ð¼ð»ð´ ðð½ð½ð¼ð¶ð»ðð²ð± ð¡ð²ð ð£ð¿ð²ðð¶ð±ð²ð»ð & ððð¢ ð¼ð³ ð¥ð²ðð®ð¶ð¹ ðð¼ðð»ð°ð¶ð¹ ð¼ð³ ðð®ð»ð®ð±ð® RCC's Board of Directors is pleased to announce the appointment of Kim Furlong as the new President & Chief Executive Officer, effective September 2, 2025. results.title: Kim Furlong Appointed New President & CEO of Retail ...
results.content: Retail Council of Canada is instantly ‘back on the court’ with the appointment of Kim Furlong as President and CEO. 𝗞𝗶𝗺 𝗙𝘂𝗿𝗹𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗔𝗽𝗽𝗼𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗡𝗲𝘄 𝗣𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁 & 𝗖𝗘𝗢 𝗼𝗳 𝗥𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹 𝗖𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗶𝗹 𝗼𝗳 𝗖𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗱𝗮 RCC's Board of Directors is pleased to announce the appointment of Kim Furlong as the new President & Chief Executive Officer, effective September 2, 2025. Currently serving as CEO of the Canadian Venture Capital & Private Equity Association (CVCA), Kim has established herself as a powerful advocate for Canada's private capital sector, successfully influencing public policy and shaping the national investment landscape. Brisebois will continue to serve as President & CEO of Retail Council of Canada until Kim joins RCC in September. Kim Furlong Appointed New President & CEO of Retail Council of Canada   https://www.retailcouncil.org Congratulations Kim, and RCC. Wonderful news Kim Furlong! Congratulations Kim!

Kim joins RCC with a distinguished career that spans over two decades at the intersection of government, industry, and advocacy—making her uniquely equipped to lead our organization into its next phase of growth. Currently serving as CEO of the Canadian Venture Capital & Private Equity Association (CVCA), Kim has established herself as a powerful advocate for Canada's private capital sector, successfully influencing public policy and shaping the national investment landscape. [Diane J. Brisebois](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/diane-j-brisebois-87629412?trk=public_post_reshare-text) will continue to serve as President & CEO of Retail Council of Canada until Kim joins RCC in September. results.content: We also have restaurants in the UK our sister company which are at times the responsibility of the Managing Director to deliver results in both businesses.The Managing Director is responsible for the successful leadership and management of the organization according to the strategic direction set by the Board of Directors.**Primary Duties and Responsibilities\*****The Managing Director Is Responsible For The Following***Leadership* * Participate with the Board of Directors in developing a vision and strategic plan to guide the organization * Develop an operational plan which incorporates goals and objectives that work towards the strategic direction of the organization * Ensure that the Board of Directors and the organization carries appropriate and adequate insurance coverage
results.raw_content:
### Managing Director

# Managing Director

#### Soul Restaurants Canada Inc. 9 years ago

* [Report this job](https://www.linkedin.com/uas/login?fromSignIn=true&session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fjobs%2Fview%2Fmanaging-director-175920801&trk=public_jobs_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=JOB&_f=guest-reporting)

**Job Purpose**Soul Restaurants Canada Inc. based in Toronto, Ontario. We are one of Canada's largest restaurant companies in terms of system restaurants with over 200 restaurants located from one end of Ontario to the other, British Columbia and Gatineau QC. KFC, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell together form the Soul Restaurant Brand. We also have restaurants in the UK our sister company which are at times the responsibility of the Managing Director to deliver results in both businesses.The Managing Director is responsible for the successful leadership and management of the organization according to the strategic direction set by the Board of Directors.**Primary Duties and Responsibilities\*****The Managing Director Is Responsible For The Following***Leadership*

* Participate with the Board of Directors in developing a vision and strategic plan to guide the organization
* Identify, assess, and inform the Board of Directors of internal and external issues that affect the organization
* Act as a professional advisor to the Board of Director on all aspects of the organization's activities
* Foster effective team work between the Board and the Executive Director and between the Executive Director and staff
* In addition to the Chair of the Board, act as a spokesperson for the organization
* Conduct official correspondence on behalf of the Board as appropriate and jointly with the Board when appropriate

*Operational planning and management*

* Develop an operational plan which incorporates goals and objectives that work towards the strategic direction of the organization
* Ensure that the operation of the organization meets the expectations of its clients
* Oversee the efficient and effective day-to-day operation of the organization
* Draft policies for the approval of the Board and prepare procedures to implement the organizational policies; review existing policies on an annual basis and recommend changes to the Board as appropriate
* Ensure that personnel files are securely stored and privacy/confidentiality is maintained
* Provide support to the Board by preparing meeting agenda and supporting materials

*Human resources planning and management*

* Determine staffing requirements for organizational management and program delivery
* Oversee the implementation of the human resources policies, procedures and practices including the development of job description for all staff
* Establish a positive, healthy and safe work environment in accordance with all appropriate legislation and regulations
* Recruit, interview and select staff that have the right technical and personal abilities to help further the organization's mission
* Ensure that all staff receives an orientation to the organization and that appropriate training is provided
* Implement a performance management process for all staff which includes monitoring the performance of staff on an on-going basis and conducting an annual performance review
* Coach and mentor staff as appropriate to improve performance
* Discipline staff when necessary using appropriate techniques; release staff when necessary using appropriate and legally defensible procedures

*Financial planning and management*

* Ensure that sound bookkeeping and accounting procedures are followed
* Provide the Board with comprehensive, regular reports on the revenues and expenditure of the organization

*Risk management*

* Identify and evaluate the risks to the organization's people, property, finances, goodwill, and image and implement measures to control risks
* Ensure that the Board of Directors and the organization carries appropriate and adequate insurance coverage
* Ensure that the Board and staff understand the terms, conditions and limitations of the insurance coverage

**Ideal Candidate Requirements***Education*

* University degree in a related field

*Professional designation**None**Knowledge, skills and abilities*

* Knowledge of leadership and management principles
* Knowledge of human resources management
* Knowledge of financial management
* Knowledge of project management

**Proficiency In The Use Of Computers For**

* Word processing
* Financial management
* E-mail
* Internet

*Flexibility and availability for extensive travel**Personal characteristics***The Managing Director Should Demonstrate Competence In Some Or All Of The Following**

* Adaptability: Demonstrate a willingness to be flexible, versatile and/or tolerant in a changing work environment while maintaining effectiveness and efficiency.
* Behave Ethically: Understand ethical behaviour and business practices, and ensure that own behaviour and the behaviour of others is consistent with these standards and aligns with the values of the organization.
* Build Relationships: Establish and maintain positive working relationships with others to achieve the goals of the organization.
* Communicate Effectively: Speak, listen and write in a clear, thorough and timely manner using appropriate and effective communication tools and techniques.
* Creativity/Innovation: Develop new and unique ways to improve operations of the organization and to create new opportunities.
* Focus on Client Needs: Anticipate, understand, and respond to the needs of internal and external clients to meet or exceed their expectations within the organizational parameters.
* Foster Teamwork: Work cooperatively and effectively with others to set goals, resolve problems, and make decisions that enhance organizational effectiveness.
* Lead: Positively influence others to achieve results that are in the best interest of the organization.
* Make Decisions: Assess situations to determine the importance, urgency and risks, and make clear decisions which are timely and in the best interests of the organization.
* Organize: Set priorities, develop a work schedule, monitor progress towards goals, and track details, data, information and activities
* Plan: Determine strategies to move the organization forward, set goals, create and implement actions plans, and evaluate the process and results.
* Solve Problems: Assess problem situations to identify causes, gather and process relevant information, generate possible solutions, and make recommendations and/or resolve the problem.
* Think Strategically: Assesses options and actions based on trends and conditions in the environment, and the vision and values of the organization.

**Experience**

* 5 or more years of progressive management experience

**Compensation $180,000 per annum open to negotiations****Benefits medical, dental, ext health and RRSP****Please Apply By Mail****Kathleen Amizial****HR Manager****Soul Restaurants Canada Inc.****4950 Yonge St., Suite 2001****Toronto, Ontario,M2N 6K1**

* ### Seniority level

   Not Applicable
* ### Employment type

   Full-time
* ### Job function

   Other
* ### Industries

   Restaurants, Food and Beverage Services, and Retail

results.title: Restaurants Canada
results.content:
Overview:
Restaurants Canada is a national, not-for-profit member-based trade association advancing the potential of Canada’s diverse and dynamic foodservice industry through member programs, research, advocacy, resources and events. Canada’s foodservice sector is a $100 billion industry that serves 22 million customers across the country every day. As the fourth-largest private-sector employer, Canadian foodservice directly employs 1.2 million people and indirectly supports another 290,000+ jobs in related industries, with $32 billion in food and beverage products purchased every year. www.restaurantscanada.org

# Restaurants Canada
The voice of foodservice | La voix des services alimentaires
Non-profit Organizations • Toronto, Ontario • 37,784 followers • 11-50 employees

## Overview
Restaurants Canada is a national, not-for-profit member-based trade association advancing the potential of Canada’s diverse and dynamic foodservice industry through member programs, research, advocacy, resources and events. Canada’s foodservice sector is a $100 billion industry that serves 22 million customers across the country every day. As the fourth-largest private-sector employer, Canadian foodservice directly employs 1.2 million people and indirectly supports another 290,000+ jobs in related industries, with $32 billion in food and beverage products purchased every year. www.restaurantscanada.org

Chris takes us behind the numbers—like why alcohol sales are slipping, why solo dining is on the rise, and how his POST strategy (Pricing, Operations, Staffing, Technology) can help operators tackle rising costs head-on. results.title: Léopold Turgeon - Senior consultant - Retail
results.content:
Léopold Turgeon
Senior consultant - Retail
Montreal, Quebec, Canada
500 connections, 3146 followers


About
Since 2013, Leopold Turgeon has been the Chairman and CEO of the Quebec Retail Council - Conseil Québécois du commerce de détail (CQCD), the organization representing the interests of Quebec's retail industry, from small to medium-sized businesses (SMEs) to large retail groups. The Quebec retail council works on major issues pertaining to the retail industry such as employment and the workforce, cross-border and interprovincial ecommerce (taxes), the technological appropriation and the digital shift of Quebec retailers, regulatory relief and much more.


Experience
Chairman and CEO
[Retail council of Québec](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/cqcd-detaillants)  
Jan 2013 - Sep 2019
630 Sherbrooke ouest, Montreal
As Chairman and CEO of the Quebec Retail Council - Conseil québécois du commerce de détail - , my mission is to represent, promote and enhance the retail sector in Quebec and promote the advancement of our members, from SMEs to large groups.Through our active participation in various associations, government agencies, public and parapublic organizations, we are working to advance major issues related to the retail sector such as:➡️ The labor market and the workforce➡️ Cross-border and interprovincial eCommerce (taxes)➡️ Technological appropriation and the digital shift of Quebec retailers➡️ Sustainable development ➡️ Payroll taxes➡️ Credit card rates➡️ Labor standards➡️ Taxation of entrepreneurs➡️ Regulatory relief➡️ Data and personal information protectionWe also organize two major events that bring together nearly 2,800 participants per year. HOP! The Retail Summit is undoubtedly the most important retail event in Quebec, and has seen many prominent speakers over the years. TAG - Retail in the digital age (formerly eCommerce-Quebec) is the essential meeting place to address the digital era and new technologies for the Quebec retail industry. Always close to the latest trends in the field, it brings together high level speakers (national and international) to enrich an industry that is resolutely turned towards the future.


Education
Université du Québec à Chicoutimi
Certificate, Administration
1986 - 1989
None
results.raw_content:
# Léopold Turgeon **Senior consultant - Retail** Montreal, Quebec, Canada, CA 500 connections, 3146 followers ## About Since 2013, Leopold Turgeon has been the Chairman and CEO of the Quebec Retail Council - Conseil Québécois du commerce de détail (CQCD), the organization representing the interests of Quebec's retail industry, from small to medium-sized businesses (SMEs) to large retail groups

The Quebec retail council works on major issues pertaining to the retail industry such as employment and the workforce, cross-border and interprovincial ecommerce (taxes), the technological appropriation and the digital shift of Quebec retailers, regulatory relief and much more

## Experience ### Chairman and CEO [Retail council of Québec](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/cqcd-detaillants) Jan 2013 - Sep 2019 630 Sherbrooke ouest, Montreal As Chairman and CEO of the Quebec Retail Council - Conseil québécois du commerce de détail - , my mission is to represent, promote and enhance the retail sector in Quebec and promote the advancement of our members, from SMEs to large groups.Through our active participation in various associations, government agencies, public and parapublic organizations, we are working to advance major issues related to the retail sector such as:➡️ The labor market and the workforce➡️ Cross-border and interprovincial eCommerce (taxes)➡️ Technological appropriation and the digital shift of Quebec retailers➡️ Sustainable development ➡️ Payroll taxes➡️ Credit card rates➡️ Labor standards➡️ Taxation of entrepreneurs➡️ Regulatory relief➡️ Data and personal information protectionWe also organize two major events that bring together nearly 2,800 participants per year. HOP! The Retail Summit is undoubtedly the most important retail event in Quebec, and has seen many prominent speakers over the years. TAG - Retail in the digital age (formerly eCommerce-Quebec) is the essential meeting place to address the digital era and new technologies for the Quebec retail industry. results.title: Léopold Turgeon - Senior consultant - Retail
results.content:
Léopold Turgeon
Senior consultant - Retail
Montreal, Quebec, Canada
500 connections, 3146 followers


About
Since 2013, Leopold Turgeon has been the Chairman and CEO of the Quebec Retail Council - Conseil Québécois du commerce de détail (CQCD), the organization representing the interests of Quebec's retail industry, from small to medium-sized businesses (SMEs) to large retail groups. The Quebec retail council works on major issues pertaining to the retail industry such as employment and the workforce, cross-border and interprovincial ecommerce (taxes), the technological appropriation and the digital shift of Quebec retailers, regulatory relief and much more.


Experience
Chairman and CEO
[Retail council of Québec](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/cqcd-detaillants)  
Jan 2013 - Sep 2019
630 Sherbrooke ouest, Montreal
As Chairman and CEO of the Quebec Retail Council - Conseil québécois du commerce de détail - , my mission is to represent, promote and enhance the retail sector in Quebec and promote the advancement of our members, from SMEs to large groups.Through our active participation in various associations, government agencies, public and parapublic organizations, we are working to advance major issues related to the retail sector such as:➡️ The labor market and the workforce➡️ Cross-border and interprovincial eCommerce (taxes)➡️ Technological appropriation and the digital shift of Quebec retailers➡️ Sustainable development ➡️ Payroll taxes➡️ Credit card rates➡️ Labor standards➡️ Taxation of entrepreneurs➡️ Regulatory relief➡️ Data and personal information protectionWe also organize two major events that bring together nearly 2,800 participants per year. HOP! The Retail Summit is undoubtedly the most important retail event in Quebec, and has seen many prominent speakers over the years. TAG - Retail in the digital age (formerly eCommerce-Quebec) is the essential meeting place to address the digital era and new technologies for the Quebec retail industry. Always close to the latest trends in the field, it brings together high level speakers (national and international) to enrich an industry that is resolutely turned towards the future.


Education
Université du Québec à Chicoutimi
Certificate, Administration
1986 - 1989
None

results.content:
Michael Terlecki
Co-owner Restaurant L'Orignal
Montreal, Quebec, Canada
461 connections, 463 followers


About
As the co-owner of a restaurant that has thrived for over 17 years, I bring extensive experience in hospitality, team building, and leadership. Alongside my sister, we’ve built a successful, customer-focused business where I’ve honed my ability to create memorable dining experiences, identify areas for improvement, and hire key talent that drives our success. I’m known for my quick thinking, problem-solving skills, and ability to stay calm under pressure—qualities that have made me well-liked by both my team and clients. I take pride in creating an environment where everyone feels valued, and I’m deeply committed to continually improving both my business and myself. Outside of my work in hospitality, I’m an aspiring actor with a passion for the craft. When I’m not at the restaurant, I’m an avid golfer, always seeking to improve my game and personal growth. Whether it’s refining the guest experience or perfecting my swing, I’m dedicated to being the best version of myself. Let’s connect if you’re interested in hospitality, leadership, or just want to chat about golf or acting!

results.title: Gary Hayes - Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
results.content:
Gary Hayes
Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
Pointe-Claire, Quebec, Canada
500 connections, 18052 followers


About
With a rich background in Canadian retailing, I have been at the forefront of innovative concepts that have left a lasting mark on the industry. One of my notable achievements was pioneering the BAYMART discount store concept at The Bay, long before the advent of Walmart in Canada. The success of BAYMART led to an expanded role, where I steered The Bay's foray into apparel, positioning it as a fashion leader in the 70's. Transitioning from department stores to specialty retail, I took on roles of increasing responsibility at Reitman's. As Vice President of Smart Set, and later as VP of Reitman's in the 80's, I introduced the groundbreaking in-season "item" repeat concept, a strategy that anticipated the "fast fashion" approach adopted by industry giants like Forever 21, H&M, and Zara. My journey then led me to Giant Tiger, where I devised and executed a robust fashion apparel strategy, fortifying GT against the challenges posed by Walmart. The events I orchestrated, including the PJ Party, Breast Cancer, Get Fit, Garden Party, and Canada Day celebrations, commanded a dominant presence in the market. I leverage my extensive experience in department stores, specialty retail, and discount stores to navigate the dynamic landscape of digital marketing. I know what has to be done on social media. My focus lies in evaluating retail strategies and uncovering emerging opportunities, all of which are meticulously documented in my weekly reports. THE REPORT: At the heart of my work is a weekly senior management report, meticulously crafted to unveil potential opportunities and highlight potential pitfalls. Armed with unfiltered information, this report empowers decision-makers to pose the right questions and allocate resources strategically to address the most pressing challenges.


Experience
Owner
[Retail Adventure Inc.](N/A)  
Jun 1999 - Present
Montreal, Quebec, Canada



Education
University of Oregon
Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.), Marketing/Marketing Management, General
1959 - 1963
Activities and Societies: foreign students scholarship for academic excellence.
